modules.description: Provides functions to manage Ethernet connections, including writing frames with specified source and destination MAC addresses, handling input packets via protocol-specific callbacks, and retrieving the MAC address and MTU. Operates on types such as Macaddr.t, Cstruct.t, and custom error types. Used to construct and process Ethernet packets, route incoming traffic based on protocol, and cleanly disconnect from the network layer.

Handles ARP request and response message parsing, construction, and validation using IPv4 addresses and Ethernet MAC addresses. Processes ARP packets to resolve hardware addresses from IP addresses in networked environments. Used in network stack implementations to facilitate communication between devices on the same local network.

Provides functions to convert ARP operation codes to and from integers, calculate the size of an ARP frame, and pretty-print frames or errors. Works with Ethernet and IPv4 ARP frames represented as a record type and error variants. Decodes byte buffers into frames, encodes frames into new buffers, and checks frame equality.

Handles ARP cache operations including adding static entries, managing IPv4 to MAC address mappings, and processing ARP input. Works with IPv4 addresses, MAC addresses, and custom state types. Used to resolve IP addresses to MACs, manage dynamic and static entries, and generate ARP replies or requests during network communication.

Handles ARP protocol operations including querying MAC addresses from IP addresses, managing IP bindings with GARP announcements, and processing incoming ARP frames. Works with IP addresses (IPv4) and MAC addresses, maintaining a cache of resolved addresses. Used to dynamically update and query network address mappings in a network interface.
